{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3150258,"name":"Kendree C","username":"kchenturtles","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kchenturtles/{size}/200823_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-22T01:42:37.356Z","cooked":"

I’m trying to simulate paths with wpilib’s simulation support - my drivetrain uses Falcon 500s and a NavX gyro. For some reason, whenever I try running just a simple drive straight command in simulated auton, it just spins in place instead of driving straight. Has anyone else had this problem?
Here is a link to my code.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2023-02-22T01:42:37.356Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":41,"readers_count":40,"score":28.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":427664,"topic_slug":"simulated-drivetrain-spins-instead-of-driving-straight","display_username":"Kendree C","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/lobstahbots/2023-Robot-Code/blob/drivetrain-sim/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/DriveBase.java","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"2023-Robot-Code/DriveBase.java at drivetrain-sim · lobstahbots/2023-Robot-Code · GitHub","clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53973,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"washed FRC alum | 246A | FIRSTxMIT"},"post_url":"/t/simulated-drivetrain-spins-instead-of-driving-straight/427664/1","custom_user_title":"washed FRC alum | 246A | FIRSTxMIT","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3150274,"name":"NewtonCrosby","username":"NewtonCrosby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ed8c4c/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-22T02:36:02.923Z","cooked":"

I think the culprit is probably your extension of DifferentialDrive. I think the new DifferntialDrive doesn’t handle inversion the same way it used to.

Really though, looking at your drive code, you probably don’t need the DifferentialDrive subclass at all. You’re already setting Talon inversion, you may as well just set follower modes and omit the motorcontroller groups and things you’re trying to use.

Here’s one way to do it, but there are many ways to skin the cat. You can see how we drive teleop lower down in the source file in the teleop_drive method.

I’ve ran into this before.
my first thought on this was that you hadn’t inverted one side of the motors. wpilib changed last year to make DifferentialDrive not automatically invert it but I saw that you had in fact inverted them so that isn’t the culprit.
and it doesn’t look like you have any inversion elsewhere so not sure what’s wrong.
